meanings.definition: To impose or place before something else.
meanings.sent1: She preimposed her rules before starting the game.
meanings.sent2: The teacher preimposed the deadline for the project.
meanings.sent3: The cat preimposed its nap time on the sunny spot by the window.
meanings.sent4: The clouds preimposed their presence over the clear blue sky.
meanings.sent5: The chef preimposed the order of cooking steps to avoid confusion.

meanings.definition: To lay down or set forth beforehand.
meanings.sent1: He preimposed the terms of the agreement before signing.
meanings.sent2: The company preimposed safety regulations for all employees.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel preimposed its route to gather nuts efficiently.
meanings.sent4: The mountain preimposed its majestic silhouette against the sunset.
meanings.sent5: The author preimposed the plot twists early in the book.

meanings.definition: To prescribe or dictate in advance.
meanings.sent1: The doctor preimposed a strict diet plan for the patient.
meanings.sent2: The government preimposed new regulations on businesses.
meanings.sent3: The magician preimposed the sequence of tricks for his performance.
meanings.sent4: The river preimposed its winding path through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The coach preimposed the training schedule for the team.
